Onward! Chair s Welcome  Welcome to Onward!. Onward! is the place for presenting original and radically 
different ideas for program­ ming languages, software engineering, and applications. Onward! takes a 
broad and inclusive view of com­ putation and in particular, has encouraged contributions in.uenced by 
other disciplines such as art, philosophy, psychology, sociology, anthropology, biology, economics, communities, 
politics, and ethics. We consider Onward! the place for presentation of not so well proven but well argued 
ideas including ground-break­ ing ideas at an early stage, where empirical validation is not yet possible. 
There is also an increasing need to describe systems and projects whose results are dif.cult to explain 
to non-experts, such as the behavior of long-running soft­ ware systems for such a system, a .lm as opposed 
to a real-time demo might be the better medium. Early ideas and non-textual presentations of systems 
are usually rejected by program committees often properly because many of them lead indeed to vaporware. 
But some of them have been the source for revolutions in hardware and software, in theory as well as 
in practice. Conferences where these types of ideas can be communicated, discussed, and scrutinized in 
a thor­ough manner have become rare. Onward! is designed to be the forum where nascent ideas can be presented 
and discussed in a conference setting. There is still a long way to go to completely realize this concept, 
but I think the .nal contributions selected for this year s conference are a very good step in this direction. 
The Onward! keynote speaker is Thomas W. Malone, one of the thought leaders on how collective intelligence 
and information technology enable new types of project organization. Onward! also offers a wild mix of 
workshop topics covering software development environments, fragile ideas, usability, the culture of 
programming languages, and green computing. Ground-breaking ideas are provided in the essay and research 
papers sessions. We have also established a session called Innovation in Progress, which focuses on emerging 
ideas. A panel on green software will discuss the impact of hardware and software systems on earth s 
carbon foot print. Feature and short .lms round out the conference with the presentation of software 
systems and ideas from unusual perspectives. I am looking forward to a great conference. Bernd Bruegge 
Technische Universität München Onward! General Chair Co-located with
